Leland follows the story of Leland P. Fitzgerald (Ryan Gosling), a disaffected teenager who has apparently murdered a severely retarded peer, the brother of his would-be lover. I loved October Sky. The thing I loved most had to be the music. It worked two ways: in the first hour of the film, it gives off a sense of hunger competition between friends and unlikeliness of the situation. In the second half of the film, the dramatic romance aspect really kicks in and I like to think that the music is a result of this. But either way, it work really well for both of these emotions or feelings I should say.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The film, based on a short story by Raymond Carver, uses flashbacks to trace the origins of the hatred and ultimately to remind us that there should be room for everybody, and second chances should be granted to allow people to show a better side of themselves, if that side is there.
